article_node.title: Stocks Supported as Chances Improve for a Fed Rate Cut
article_node.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.51%, Nasdaq up 0.79% and the Dow slipped 0.05% as markets rallied on the backdrop of falling 10‑year Treasury yields and heightened expectations of a Fed rate cut.  Megacap tech names led the rally, with Alphabet jumping 9% after an antitrust ruling and Apple up 3% following a court decision on its Google search deal, while energy stocks fell as WTI dropped over 2%.  Fed officials signaled a likely cut at the next meeting, with futures pricing a 25‑bp cut at 95% probability, reinforcing the positive sentiment for the equity market.
